result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob J Roth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate Foreign Protection Order [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.128(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay statutory costs

--to pay court appointed attorney fees

--$68 dollars in subpoena fees

**Per 6-22-2016 Order - Attorney Fees granted in the amount of $315**
--no possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition

--no contact with Chelynne Moline, the Court does not prohibit 3rd party contact for purposes of child placement/exchange, the 3rd party is NOT to be Heidi Sacia.

--no acts or threats of violence

--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

The Court determines that Mr. Roth has already provided a DNA sample, does not order another be provided
  
-- If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY:  FORT ATKINSON PD

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob J Roth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. Colleen Locke as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $315
with attachments and proposed order for payment of court appointed defense counsel fees from Attorney Colleen Locke in the amount of $315 .
of the Plea and Sentencing Hearing held on April 4, 2016  before the Honorable David J Wambach
Criminal Case Settlement with criminal complaint and Final Order from Family Court in Pennsylvania

Case called at 3:09pm [mo]
Defendant Jacob J Roth in court with Attorney Colleen Jane Locke.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim right compliance; submits a victim impact statement

recess:3:15pm-- reconvene: 3:20pm

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with condition:
--no contact with Chelynne Moline, the Court does not prohibit 3rd party contact for purposes of child placement/exchange, the 3rd party is NOT to be Heidi Sacia.
--$68 dollars in subpoena fees
--to pay court appointed attorney fees

The Court adopts all other conditions as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are:
--to undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon or ammunition
--no acts or threats of violence
--to pay statutory costs]



Days credit for time already served:  0 days
The Court determines that Mr. Roth has already provided a DNA sample, does not order another be provided
recess: 3:56pm
made by Defense on this day

Case called at 2:07pm [mo]
Defendant Jacob J Roth in court with attorney Colleen Jane Locke.  ADA Monica Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; Speedy trial demanded by Defense 

The Court requires $2500  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence towards anyone
--no contact with Chelynne Moline, except for child exchange through 3rd party. Third Party may not be Heidi Sacia
--no presence at the residence of Chelynne Moline
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess: 2:19pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/9/2016 at 10:40am   (2) FSSC on 4/4/16 at 3:00pm (2) Jury Trial on 4/7/16 at 8:30am  ((time limits apply))
The Court grants the request to reschedule the matter to February 23,2016 at 2:00pm
Affidavit in support of Motion to Reschedule Hearing
Notice of Motion and Motion to Reschedule Hearing

Court appoints Attorney Locke
Court orders reimbursement of $30 per month with the first payment due on 2/29/16.
